  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11327362905/job/31498267160)

Seems to do what it says on the tin
Seems to do what it says on the tin

There's a number of changes like this where you keep a `hi` that's now about an inaccessible variable, which I think people previously weren't excited about, but if core is going to warn on them, I guess we need to.

I think this is a valid point. Would it be possible to replace `i` with `_i` in cases like this? Might be hard to automate...
I guess `hi` could also become `h`. But that seems even harder to automate.

The rule might be: if `i` is unused, replace it with `_`, unless there is a named-and-used variable that depends on it, in which case, replace with `_i`.
